text: Carcharodon caifassii or also know a "Bryan't White Shark", is an extinct species of Great White Shark that lived during in Pliocene epochs. He lived in Europa, Italy, and is considered the direct ancestor of the current Great White Shark (Carcharodon carcharias). Some paleontologists believe that he may have been one of the causes of the extinction of the megalodon. == References == Category:Extinct fish Category:Miocene Category:Pliocene
title: Carcharodon caifassii
